title: Inference procedure for body fat exercise program

content.description:
A fitness center offers a one-month program designed to reduce body fat through exercise. The table shows the body fat percentage before and after completing the program for 10 randomly selected participants.

The director of the program wants to investigate whether knowing the body fat percentage before beginning the program can help to predict body fat percentage for someone who completes the program.
content.question: Which of the following procedures is the most appropriate for such an investigation?

choices.label: A matched-pairs t-test for a mean difference
A two-sample t-test for a difference between means
A two-sample z-test for a difference between proportions
A linear regression t-test for slope

content.answer: A linear regression t-test for slope

topic.text: 9.4: Setting Up a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
